Elements.CanonicalName: Name of object in canonical format ex: domain.local/Domain Controllers
Elements.City: Name of City where object belongs to
Elements.CommonName: Name of object which is used by Active Directory to perform search
Elements.Country: Name of Country where object belongs to
Elements.DisplayName: Name of object used to display on screen
Elements.DistinguishedName: Name of object uniquely identifies entry to ntds.dit database
Elements.GPLink: Name of gpo id which is connected to an object
Elements.InstanceType: Bitfield dictates how the object is instantiated on server.1 - Head of naming context;2 - repica not instantiated;4-object is writable;8-naming context above this object is held,16-naming context is constructing for the first time by replication,32-naming contextis in proces of being remover from local Directory System Agent(DSA)
Elements.IsCriticalSystemObject: If TRUE then object is replicated during installation of new replica
Elements.LastKnownParent: DistinguishedName of object of last know parent of orphaned object
Elements.ManagedBy: DistinguishedName of object which is assigned to manage this object
Elements.Modified: Calculated attribute by AD to point when the object is modified
Elements.Name: Name of an object
Elements.ObjectCategory: Defines category of an object. Single value property of class which is an instance of on or its superclasses.When an object is created, the system sets its objectCategory property to the value specified by the defaultObjectCategory property of its object class. An object's objectCategory property cannot be changed.
Elements.ObjectClass: Defines class of an object. It is set when object is created and cannot be changed.
Elements.ObjectGuid: Unique identifier for an object. It cannot be changed.
Elements.PostalCode: Defines postal code of an object
Elements.ProtectedFromAccidentalDeletion: Defines an object which has property protected from accidental deletion
Elements.ShowInAdvancedViewOnly: Defines an object which can be visible only in advanced view
Elements.State: Name of State where object belongs to
Elements.StreetAddress: Name of street where object belongs to
Elements.USNChanged: Parameter changed when the object is changed. Also it changes global USN parameter. USN-update sequence number
Elements.USNCreated: Parameter is assigned at object creation
Elements.WhenChanged: Date when the object is last changed. It is not replicated and exist in GlobalCatalog
Elements.WhenCreated: Date when this object was created. This value is replicated and is in the global catalog.

Elements.CanonicalName: Name of object in canonical format ex: domain.local/Domain Controllers
Elements.CommonName: Name of object which is used by Active Directory to perform search
Elements.DistinguishedName: Name of object uniquely identifies entry to ntds.dit database
Elements.GroupCategory: Category of Group. Security - used to assign permissions to shared resources;Deistribution-used to create email distribution list
Elements.GroupScope: Scope of group. Universal-can access to resources in multiple domains connected in forest;Global-used to provide access to resources in own or another domain. Members are only from the domain where the group is created. It can be addedd to other global and local groups. It is used for merging users or groups into one object and give them access to resources.;DomainLocal-used for manage direct access to resources like files,folders,remote desktop access where group is created. Group cannot be used in other domains, but may incude users from another domain. Local group can contain other local group, but cannot be added to global group.
Elements.GroupType: Set of flags defines type and scope of group object. 1-group created by system,2-global group,4-domain local group,8-universal group,16-APP_BASIC group for WS Authorization Manager,32-APP_QUERY group for WS Authorization Manager,-2147483648-security group. If it is not set then group is distribution.
Elements.HomePage: HomePage of an Object. It can be used as sharepoint homepage in intranet.
Elements.InstanceType: Bitfield dictates how the object is instantiated on server.1 - Head of naming context;2 - repica not instantiated;4-object is writable;8-naming context above this object is held,16-naming context is constructing for the first time by replication,32-naming contextis in proces of being remover from local Directory System Agent(DSA)
Elements.ManagedBy: DistinguishedName of object which is assigned to manage this object
Elements.MemberOf: Name of object which group is member of
Elements.Name: Name of an Object
Elements.ObjectCategory: Defines category of an object. Single value property of class which is an instance of on or its superclasses.When an object is created, the system sets its objectCategory property to the value specified by the defaultObjectCategory property of its object class. An object's objectCategory property cannot be changed.
Elements.ObjectClass: Defines class of an object. It is set when object is created and cannot be changed.
Elements.ObjectGuid: Unique identifier for an object. It cannot be changed.
Elements.ProtectedFromAccidentalDeletion: Defines an object which has property protected from accidental deletion
Elements.SamAccounName: Logon name used to support client and servers from previous Windows version
Elements.SamAccountType: Contains information about every object in Active directory. 0-domain object,268435456-group object,16777217-non security group object,536870912-alias object,536870913-non security alias object,805306368-user object,805306368-normal user account,805306369-machine account,805306370-trust account,1073741824-app basic group,1073741825-app query group,2147483647-account type max
Elements.SID: Value that uniquelly identifies an object. Security Identifier
Elements.SIDHistory: Contain provious SID of an object, if the object is moved from another domain. When object is moved then the new SID is created and becomes SID. Old SID is added to that property.
Elements.USNChanged: Parameter changed when the object is changed. Also it changes global USN parameter. USN-update sequence number
Elements.USNCreated: Parameter is assigned at object creation
Elements.WhenChanged: Date when the object is last changed. It is not replicated and exist in GlobalCatalog
Elements.WhenCreated: Date when this object was created. This value is replicated and is in the global catalog.

Elements.BadLogonCount:: number of times the user tried to log on to the account using an incorrect password
Elements.CannotChangePassword: Parameter indicates if user can or cannot change password
Elements.CanonicalName: Name of object in canonical format ex: domain.local/Domain Controllers
Elements.Certificates: Name of certificates issued to an object
Elements.ChangePasswordAtLogon: Parameter indicates that an object must change password at next logon
Elements.City: Name of City where object belongs to
Elements.CommonName: Name of object which is used by Active Directory to perform search
Elements.Company: Name of company where object belongs to
Elements.Country: Name of Country where object belongs to
Elements.DesktopProfile: Attribute specifies location of the desktop profile for object
Elements.Department: Name of department where object belongs to
Elements.DirectReports: Direct employee which object report to
Elements.DisplayName: Name of object used to display on screen
Elements.DistinguishedName: Name of object uniquely identifies entry to ntds.dit database
Elements.Division: Name of division where object belongs to
Elements.DoesNotRequirePreAuth: Indicates if object not require pre authentication. It is used with legacy apps.
Elements.Enabled: Parameter indicates that the account is turned off or on
Elements.GivenName: It is a simple not technical name of object
Elements.GroupMembershipSAM: Windows NT Security. Down level Windows NT support.
Elements.HomeDirRequired: Indicates is Home Directory is required for this object
Elements.HomeDrive: Specify the drive letter to which map UNC path specified in homeDirectory.Drive letter must be [letter]: like C:
Elements.LastBadPasswordAttempt: Date when bad password islast assigned to this object
Elements.LastKnownParent: DistinguishedName of object of the last known parent of object
Elements.LastLogOn: Date when the object last log on. It is stored as large int. It is number of 100-nanosecond intervals since 1 January 1601.
Elements.LastLogOff: Date when the object last log off
Elements.LastLogonDate: Last date when object is logged
Elements.LockedOut: If true then account is lockedout
Elements.LockoutTime: Date and time that account was locked out. It is stored as large int. It is number of 100-nanosecond intervals since 1 January 1601.
Elements.LogonHours: Hours when object can log on
Elements.LogonWorkstations: Workstation where object can log on
Elements.MemberOf: Name of object which group is member of
